io.scif.img.cell.cache

Class MapDBCache

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.scijava.AbstractContextual
      • org.scijava.plugin.AbstractRichPlugin
        • org.scijava.service.AbstractService
          • io.scif.img.cell.cache.AbstractCacheService<SCIFIOCell<?>>
            • io.scif.img.cell.cache.MapDBCache
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CacheService<SCIFIOCell<?>>, SCIFIOService, Comparable<Prioritized>, Contextual, Disposable, Identifiable, Initializable, Locatable, Logged, HasPluginInfo, RichPlugin, SciJavaPlugin, Prioritized, Service, Versioned

    public class MapDBCache
extends AbstractCacheService<SCIFIOCell<?>>
    CacheService implementation using MapDB to store and retrieve SCIFIOCells on disk.
    Author:
    Mark Hiner

    • Method Detail

      • clearCache

        public void clearCache(String cacheId)
        NB: Disables caching on finalize in cleared cells. This is done to prevent immortal cells. Caching must be re-enabled per-cell if desired.
        Parameters:
        cacheId - cache name to clear
        See Also:
        CacheService.clearCache(String)

      • clearAllCaches

        public void clearAllCaches()
        Description copied from interface: CacheService
        Removes all entries for all caches
        See Also:

        Closes and removes the specified cache.

      • cache

        public CacheResult cache(String cacheId,
                         int index,
                         SCIFIOCell<?> cell)
        Description copied from interface: CacheService
        Caches the provided object. The cacheId and index are used as a hash key.

        NB: If successful, after invoking this method, the cached object should be considered "clean" in a dirty/clean context.

        Parameters:
        cacheId - - Cache this object belongs to
        index - - Index in the cache of this object
        cell - - object to store
        Returns:
        CacheResult based on the outcome

      • retrieve

        public SCIFIOCell<?> retrieve(String cacheId,
                              int index)
        Description copied from interface: CacheService
        Returns the object at the desired index from the specified index. The entry is not guaranteed to be removed from disk until the limit (set via CacheService.setMaxBytesOnDisk(long)) is reached. To encourage the deletion of these records early, use CacheService.cleanRetrieved(String).

        NB: the cell returned from this method will automatically attempt to re-cache itself when finalized. To disable this feature, use CacheService.retrieveNoRecache(String, int).

        Parameters:
        cacheId - - Cache the desired object belongs to
        index - - Index in the cache of the desired object
        Returns:
        The cached object for the specified id and index

      • retrieveNoRecache

        public SCIFIOCell<?> retrieveNoRecache(String cacheId,
                                       int index)
        Description copied from interface: CacheService
        As CacheService.retrieve(String, int), but any flag for automatic caching will be disabled if possible.
        Parameters:
        cacheId - - Cache the desired object belongs to
        index - - Index in the cache of the desired object
        Returns:
        The cached object for the specified id and index

      • cleanRetrieved

        public void cleanRetrieved(String cacheId)
        Description copied from interface: CacheService
        Start a new thread to remove all previously-retrieved entries for a given cache from disk. This method will automatically be invoked when the byte limit, set by CacheService.setMaxBytesOnDisk(long), is reached. But, although this process will run on a separate thread, there may be a performance hit to delete cache entries - e.g. if further caching is blocked. Use this method to pre-emptively control when records are deleted.
        Parameters:
        cacheId - - Cache to clean

      • setMaxBytesOnDisk

        public void setMaxBytesOnDisk(long maxBytes)
        Description copied from interface: CacheService
        Sets the amount of disk space available to caches created by this service's manager.
        Specified by:
        setMaxBytesOnDisk in interface CacheService<SCIFIOCell<?>>
        Overrides:
        setMaxBytesOnDisk in class AbstractCacheService<SCIFIOCell<?>>
        Parameters:
        maxBytes - - max bytes usable by this manager's disk stores.
